p:
Combining results of population demographic models (e.g. population viability analysis) with distribution models allows for a more accurate prediction of a species extinction risk due to a more detailed representation of the demographic processes
75 . Due to the lack of demographic data, we were not able to construct more dynamic models (e.g. mechanistic models), and we focused on projections of AOO as a proxy of effective habitat loss. Our results thus need to be considered with caution. However, our model-derived estimates of AOO could be useful to design conservation areas
76 , spatial priority-setting implications and conservation planning of the highly endangered mountain vipers.
